action.action-desc: Mr. Reed (for himself and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to make permanent the extension of the Medicare-dependent hospital (MDH) program and the increased payments under the Medicare low-volume hospital program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Rural Hospital Access Act of 2017.

section.header: Extension of the Medicare-dependent hospital (MDH) program

subsection.text: Section 1886(d)(5)(G) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(5)(G)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by striking , and before October 1, 2017; and
in clause (ii)(II), by striking , and before October 1, 2017.
Section 1886(b)(3)(D) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(b)(3)(D)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking , and before October 1, 2017; and
in clause (iv), by striking through fiscal year 2017 and inserting or a subsequent fiscal year.

paragraph.text: Section 13501(e)(2) of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 (42 U.S.C. 1395ww note) is amended by striking fiscal year 2000 through fiscal year 2017 and inserting a subsequent fiscal year.

section.header: Extension of the increased payments under the Medicare Low-Volume Hospital Program
section.text: Section 1886(d)(12) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(12)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by inserting for fiscal years 2005 through 2010 after increase; and
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking and for discharges occurring in fiscal year 2018 and subsequent fiscal years;
by striking fiscal years 2011 through 2017 each place it appears and inserting fiscal year 2011 and each subsequent year; and
by striking or portion of fiscal year; and
in the heading, by striking Temporary applicable percentage increase and inserting applicable percentage increase beginning with fiscal year 2011;
by striking fiscal years 2011 through 2017, and inserting fiscal year 2011 and each subsequent fiscal year; and
by striking or the portion of fiscal year each place it appears.
